result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin F. Orozco was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Vilas County 21CF226, 21CM227, 21CM231 and Ozaukee County 19CF324.
Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.
Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin F. Orozco

records.addlTxt: 2:14 PM Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco in court, in custody, without counsel.  Attorney Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Count 1: Plea of guilty.  Plea questionnaire reviewed orally on the record with Defendant. Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily. The Court conducted a colloquy with the defendant and accepted the waiver of counsel. Found guilty.  Count 1: Court imposes 6 months in Vilas County Jail  - 61 days credit.  Runs concurrent to 21CF226, 21cM227 and 21CM231 and to Ozaukee County 19CF324. Felony court costs imposed of $518, includes DNA surcharge.  Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.  Felony advisements given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with.  No victim attending today. Court is asking defendant if he would prefer to have all of his cases in front of one Judge. Defendant would like additional time to discuss plea deal with State. Court recessed. Back on record at 9:51 AM. State updates the Court as to status. Jury trial will be cancelled. Defendant requests this case be transferred to Branch II to facilitate global resolution of all matters. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Witness List Letter for Pro Se Defendants

Defendant was transported to Dodge Correctional.  Court was unaware.  Arrangements were made to reschedule.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco in court, in custody. Defendant is Pro Se.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Judge reads letter of phone numbers authorized to assist in case. Judge authorizes use of corrected number for sister. Attorney Brown and defendant agree to more to trial date.  JA will be completing scheduling order and distributing to parties. Bond Continued
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:46PM Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Motion to allow certain phone numbers for prose heard.  Phone numbers provided to the court.  State Objects. Authorization to use phone for contact with mother and sister at the numbers provided for special legal assistance. Phone number requested for girlfriend denied. Bond Cont.

11:08 AM Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco in court, in custody.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. 
 Information filed. Defendant waives reading. Not guilty plea entered., Other cases set in front of Judge Huber.  State to schedule those cases following JPTC on this case.  Bond Continued. Motion to allow certain numbers for pro se inmates to be heard at JPTC.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco in court, in custody, without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Right to counsel explained to defendant.  Defendant confirms that he would like to proceed without an attorney.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to counsel.  Correction Officer Blake Jensen, sworn in and testified. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for arraignment. State to efile information that mirrors criminal complaint.  Defendant signs waiver of right to an attorney.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report - 5 contacts
Completed on the record with Judge Nielsen, put in jail mail for signature.

Defendant Benjamin F. Orozco appeared by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Confirmed Criminal Complaint was received.  Right to counsel given by the court.  Bond set at $2,500.00 cash.  Preliminary hearing  6/6/2022 at 2:15 p.m.
